                                                                   Section A

     Question                                       Answers                                                   Notes                     Total
1.     a    i                                                                                 Must cut CH2–CO bond AND enclose all
                                                                                              of the –COOH group.

                                                                                                                                          1




1.     a    ii   Any two of:                                                                  Accept “hydrophilic part/group forms
                 –COOH/CO/OH/carboxylate/carboxyl/hydroxyl/hydroxy group forms hydrogen       hydrogen bonds/H-bonds to water”.
                 bonds/H-bonds to water ✔                                                     Accept “hydrophobic section” instead of
                                                                                              “hydrocarbon chain”.
                 London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces occur
                 between hydrocarbon chains ✔                                                 Award [1 max] for answers based on        2 max
                                                                                              “the –COOH group being polar AND the
                 hydrocarbon chain cannot form hydrogen bonds/H-bonds to water ✔              hydrocarbon chain being non-polar”.
                 strong hydrogen bonds/H-bonds between water molecules exclude hydrocarbon
                 chains «from the body of the water» ✔
                                                                          –4–                                      M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                            Answers                                                   Notes                 Total
1.     b    i     Above about 240 cm2:                                                           For both M1 and M2 accept “particles”
                  greater collision frequency/collisions per second between «palmitic acid»      for “molecules”.
                  molecules and the barrier «as area reduced» ✔                                  For M1 accept “space/area between
                                                                                                 molecules is reduced” OR “molecules
                                                                                                 moving closer together”.
                  At less than about 240 cm2:
                  molecules completely cover the surface
                  OR                                                                                                                      2
                  there is no space between molecules
                  OR
                  force from movable barrier transmitted directly through the molecules to the
                  fixed barrier
                  OR
                  «palmitic acid» molecules are pushed up/down/out of layer ✔

1.     b    ii    amount of acid  «5.0  105 dm3  0.0034 mol dm3»  1.7  107 «mol» ✔       Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                                                                          2
                  number of molecules  «1.7  107 mol  6.02  1023 mol1 » 1.0  1017 ✔      Award [1] for “1.0  10 20”.

1.     b    iii             240 cm2
                  «area                 » 2.4  1015 «cm2» ✔
                            1.0  1017                                                                                                    1
                                                                             –5–                                           M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                                                             Notes                     Total
2.     a          CaCO3 (s)  2HCl (aq)  CaCl2 (aq)  CO2 (g)  H2O (l) ✔                                 Accept “CO2 (aq)”.                          1
2.     b          measure the volume of gas at different times «plot a graph and extrapolate»              Accept other techniques that yield
                  OR                                                                                       data which can be plotted and
                                                                                                           extrapolated.                               1
                  measure the mass of the reaction mixture at different times «plot a graph and
                  extrapolate» ✔
2.     c    i     method 2 AND the marble is in excess «so a little extra has little effect»               Accept, as a reason, that “as the mass
                  OR                                                                                       is greater the percentage variation will
                                                                                                           be lower”.
                  large chips AND the marble is in excess «so a little extra has little effect»
                  OR                                                                                                                                   1
                  method 2 AND HCl is limiting reagent «so a little extra marble has little effect»
                  OR
                  large chips AND HCl is limiting reagent «so a little extra marble has little effect» ✔
2.     c    ii    surface area                                                                             Accept “shape of the chip”.
                  OR                                                                                                                                   1
                  purity «of the marble» ✔
2.     d    i     variation of individual values is much greater «than this uncertainty»
                  OR                                                                                                                                   1
                  «uncertainty» does not take into account «student» reaction time ✔
2.     d    ii        121.96 s
                  «             60.98 s »  61«s» ✔                                                                                                   1
                         2
2.     d    iii   systematic AND always makes the time shorter «than the actual value»                     Accept, as reasons, “it always affects
                  OR                                                                                       the value in the same direction” OR “the
                                                                                                           error is consistent”.
                  systematic AND it is an error in the method used «not an individual measurement»                                                     1
                  OR
                  systematic AND more repetitions would not reduce the error ✔

                                                                    Section B
Option A — Materials

      Question                                       Answers                                     Notes                 Total
 3.     a         «close packed» lattice of metal atoms/ions ✔
                                                                                                                         2
                  no spaces for water molecules to pass though the structure ✔

 3.     b    i    composite ✔                                                                                            1

 3.     b    ii   melting point                                                  Accept “colour/transparency”.
                  OR
                  permeability
                  OR
                  density
                  OR
                  conductivity                                                                                           1
                  OR
                  elasticity/stiffness
                  OR
                  brittleness/flexibility
                  OR
                  «tensile» strength ✔

(Question 3b continued)

      Question                                        Answers                                              Notes                      Total
 3.     b    iii   Any three of:                                                         Accept “ethanol” or specific
                                                                                         hydrocarbons.
                   hydrocarbon/carbon-containing gas/compound ✔
                                                                                         Accept “N2”, “H2”, “NH3” or specific inert
                   mixed with inert gas ✔                                                gases.
                   heat/high temperature ✔                                               Accept temperature or range within           3 max
                                                                                                   
                   «transition» metal catalyst ✔                                         600–800 C.
                   hydrocarbon/carbon compound decomposes to form carbon «nanotubes» ✔   Accept specific metals such as Ni, Co or
                                                                                         Fe.
                   nanotubes form on catalyst surface ✔

 3.     b    iv    rod shaped molecules ✔                                                                                               1

     Question                                       Answers                                                  Notes                       Total
4.     a    i    both have «long» hydrocarbon chains                                        Accept “CH2 –CH2 units”.
                 OR
                 both have chains comprising CH2 units ✔                                                                                  2

                 HDPE has little/no branching AND LDPE has «more» branching ✔               Accept “HDPE more crystalline”.

4.     a    ii   HDPE is more rigid/less flexible                                           Accept “HDPE has lower ductility”.
                 OR
                 HDPE has a higher melting point                                                                                          1
                 OR
                 HDPE has greater «tensile» strength ✔

4.     b    i    form «temporary» activated complexes/reaction intermediates ✔              Accept “consumed in one reaction/step
                                                                                            AND regenerated in a later reaction/step”.
                                                                                                                                          1
                                                                                            Accept “provides alternative mechanism”.

4.     b    ii   inductively coupled plasma/ICP spectroscopy using mass spectroscopy/mass   Accept “atomic absorption/aa
                 spectrometry/MS/ICP-MS                                                     spectroscopy” or “MS/mass-
                                                                                            spectroscopy/mass spectrometry”.
                 OR                                                                                                                       1
                 inductively coupled plasma/ICP spectroscopy using optical emission
                 spectroscopy/OES/ICP-OES ✔
                                                                           –9–                                        M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M



     Question                                          Answers                                                         Notes                    Total
4.     c    i                                                                                         Accept –COCl instead of –COOH.


                                                                                                                                                 2
                 –NH2 AND –COOH ✔
                 six C-atoms ✔

4.     c    ii   less AND a second molecule/product formed ✔                                          Accept “not all the reactant molecules
                                                                                                      «in the equation» are converted «to
                                                                                                      product molecules»”.                       1



4.     d         Any two of:                                                                          Accept other valid factors such as
                 many types «of plastics» exist                                                       thermal decomposition of some plastics,
                                                                                                      production of toxic fumes, etc.
                 OR
                 «plastics» require sorting «by type» ✔
                                                                                                                                                 2

                 «plastics» need to be separated from non-plastic materials
                 OR
                 «often» composites/moulded on/bound to non-plastic/other components ✔

4.     e         «different classifications are appropriate for» different properties/applications/
                 purposes ✔                                                                                                                      1

     Question                                               Answers                                                 Notes                      Total
5.     a         ratio of electrons : aluminium ions  3 : 1 ✔                                     Award [3] for correct final answer.

                                    1.296  1013 C
                 amount Al «                        »  4.48  107 «mol» ✔                                                                      3
                                   96500 Cmol1  3
                 mass Al « 4.48  107 mol  26.98 g mol1»  1.21  109 «g» ✔

5.     b         the smallest repeating unit «from which the crystal structure can be derived» ✔   Accept “building block that the structure
                                                                                                                                                1
                                                                                                   is made from”.

5.     c         «n  2d sin  »                                                                  Award [2] for correct final answer.
                 1  1.54  1010  2  d  sin 18 ✔
                                                                                                                                                2
                        1.54  10 10 m
                 d «                      »  2.49  1010 «m» ✔
                          2  0.309

5.     d    i    type 1 ✔
                                                                                                                                                2
                 superconductor ✔

5.     d    ii   collisions between electrons and «lattice of metal» ions become more frequent
                 OR                                                                                                                             1
                 thermal oscillations/vibrations disrupt the Cooper electron pairs ✔

5.     e         Ksp  [Al3] [OH]3 « 3.3  1034» ✔                                         Award [2] for correct final answer.

                                3.3  10 34                                                                                                    2
                 [ Al3 «
                 
                                              » 3.3  10–13 «mol dm3» ✔
                                (1  10 7 )3

Option B — Biochemistry

      Question                                         Answers                                           Notes                      Total
 6.     a




                 OR

                                                                                                                                     2




                 correct structures of Val AND Asn ✔
                 correct amide link ✔

 6.     b        Phenylalanine and valine:
                 London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces   Do not accept dipole-dipole interactions.
                 OR
                 permanent dipole-induced dipole «interactions» ✔                                                                    2


                 Glutamine and asparagine:
                 hydrogen bonds ✔

                 OR                                                                                                1
                 compare distance moved with known amino acids ✔

                 OR
                 sequence of three bases/nucleotides ✔                                                             2

     Question                                         Answers                                                     Notes                        Total
7.     a         hydrolytic «rancidity» ✔                                                        Accept a formula for ester group.
                 ester group ✔                                                                                                                   2



7.     b         «stearic acid» straight chain/chain has no kinks/more regular structure
                 OR
                 «stearic acid» saturated/no «carbon-carbon» double bonds ✔                      Accept “«stearic acid» greater surface
                                                                                                 area/electron density”.                      3 max
                 «stearic acid» chains pack more closely together ✔
                 stronger London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces
                 «between molecules» ✔

7.     c    i    lowers risk of heart disease/atherosclerosis
                 OR
                 lowers LDL cholesterol
                 OR
                 increases HDL cholesterol                                                                                                       1
                 OR
                 aids brain/neurological development «in children»
                 OR
                 relieves rheumatoid arthritis ✔

7.     c    ii   soluble AND non-polar hydrocarbon chain ✔                                       Accept as reasons “«predominantly»
                                                                                                 non-polar” OR “long hydrocarbon                 1
                                                                                                 chain”.

(Question 7c continued)

      Question                                          Answers                                                Notes                    Total
 7.     c    iii   not biodegradable                                                           Accept “stored/accumulate in bodies of
                                                                                               prey/animals eaten”.
                   OR
                                                                                               Accept “not excreted”.
                   stored/accumulate in fat ✔
                                                                                                                                         2
                   biomagnification occurs
                   OR
                   concentration increases along food chain ✔

 7.     c    iv    add starch/cellulose/carbohydrates/additives/catalysts «to plastic during   Accept reference to biodegradable
                   manufacture to allow digestion by micro-organisms»                          plastics other than PLA, for example
                                                                                               polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA),
                   OR
                                                                                               poly(butylene succinate) (PBS),
                   replace traditional plastics with polylactic acid/PLA-based ones            polybutylene adipate terephthalate        1
                   OR                                                                          (PBAT) and polycaprolactone (PCL).

                   blend traditional and polylactic acid/PLA-based plastics ✔

     Question                                        Answers                        Notes                 Total
8.     a        Glucose:
                readily passes through intestine wall/dissolves in blood
                OR
                is immediately available for energy/respiration
                OR
                transported rapidly around body ✔                                                          2


                Starch:
                must be hydrolysed/broken down «into smaller molecules» first ✔



8.     b        Any two of:
                long straight/unbranched chains ✔
                multiple hydrogen bonds «between chains» ✔
                                                                                                         2 max
                microfibrils
                OR
                rigid/cable structure ✔
                                                                        – 16 –                                M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                   Notes                    Total
9.     a        binds at allosteric site
                OR
                binds away from active site ✔
                                                                                                                                         2
                changes shape of active site
                OR
                renders active sites ineffective ✔

9.     b        Km is inverse measure of affinity of enzyme for a substrate                   Idea of inverse relationship must be
                                                                                              conveyed.
                OR
                Km is inversely proportional to enzyme activity                               Accept “high value of Km indicates low
                                                                                              affinity of enzyme for substrate/less
                OR                                                                            stable ES complex/lower enzyme
                                                                                              activity”.                                 1
                high value of Km indicates higher substrate concentration needed for enzyme
                saturation                                                                    Accept “low value of Km indicates high
                OR                                                                            affinity of enzyme for substrate/stable
                                                                                              ES complex/greater enzyme activity”.
                low value of Km means reaction is fast at low substrate concentration ✔
                                                                     – 17 –              M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                         Answers                               Notes                 Total
10.   a      highly conjugated systems
             OR
             alternating single and double bonds
             OR                                                                                                 2
             many delocalized electrons ✔


             electron transitions occur when visible light is absorbed ✔

10.   b      gaining protons ✔
             decreases electron density/extent of conjugation «in aromatic backbone» ✔                          3
             increases energy of electron transitions ✔

Option C — Energy

   Question                                         Answers                                                Notes                      Total
 11.   a                     Gas                                  Source
                methane/CH4 ✔                  animals
                                               OR
                                               anaerobic decomposition of organic waste
                                               OR
                                               bogs/marshes/rice paddies ✔                                                             2
                nitrogen(I) oxide/dinitrogen   bacterial action                           Accept “nitrous oxide”.
                monoxide/N2O ✔                 OR
                                               combustion of biomass ✔
                ozone/O3 ✔                     effect of UV light on oxygen/O2 ✔          Accept “electrical discharges/lightning”.


 11.   b       CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H (aq)  HCO3 (aq)                                  Accept CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  2H (aq) 
                                                                                          CO32(aq).
               OR                                                                                                                      1
                                                                                          Accept equations with single arrow.
               CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H2CO3(aq) AND H2CO3(aq)  H (aq)  HCO3 (aq) ✔

 11.   c       no change in polarity/dipole «moment when molecule vibrates» ✔             Do not accept “non-polar” or “no dipole
                                                                                          moment” – idea of change must be             1
                                                                                          there.
                                                                             – 19 –                                M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                             Answers                                                      Notes                   Total
12.   a        Any three of:
               different molar masses
               OR
               different strengths of intermolecular forces ✔


               different boiling points ✔
                                                                                                                                            3 max

               temperature in «fractionating» column decreases upwards ✔


               «components» condense at different temperatures/heights
               OR
               «component with» lower boiling point leaves column first ✔

12.   b   i                          energy released       5470 kJ mol1                           Do not accept “–47.9 «kJ g1»”.
               specific energy «                                        1
                                                                             »  47.9 «kJ g1» ✔
                                     mass consumed         114.26 g mol
                                   energy re leased                                                                                           2
               energy density «                     spe cific energy  density  47.9 kJ g –1
                                  volume consum e d                                                Do not accept “–33.7 «kJ cm3»” unless
                0.703 g cm3 »  33.7 «kJ cm3 » ✔                                                “–47.9 «kJ g1»” already penalized.

12.   b   ii   energy is lost «to the surroundings» as heat/sound/friction                         Do not accept simply “energy is lost”.
               OR
               energy is lost to the surroundings «as heat/sound/friction»                                                                    1
               OR
               incomplete combustion ✔

  Question                                           Answers                                             Notes                         Total
14.   a   i



                                                                                      Accept any balanced equation which                 3
                                                                                      shows Li oxidized to Li  for M3, such as
                                                                                      LiC6 → Li  C6 + e–     or
                                                                                      LixC6 → xLi  6C  xe–
                                                                                                  



14.   a   ii   Limiting factor:                                                       Accept “time it takes ions to diffuse
               internal resistance «of the cell» ✔                                    between electrodes”.

                                                                                                                                         2
               Electrodes design:                                                     Accept specific ways of increasing surface
                                                                                      area, such as “porous electrodes”.
               large surface area ✔
                                                                                      Accept “close together/small separation”.

14.   b   i    mass spectrometry/mass spectroscopy/MS ✔                               Accept “analysis of radiation emitted”.            1

14.   b   ii   uranium converted to uranium hexafluoride/UF6 gas ✔

               ALTERNATIVE 1:
               gas «allowed to» diffuse✔
               lower mass isotope/235U passes through more rapidly ✔
                                                                                                                                         3
               ALTERNATIVE 2:
               use of centrifuge ✔

               higher mass isotope/238U moves/closer to outside of centrifuge
               OR
               lower mass isotope/235U stays in/removed from middle of centrifuge ✔

(Question 14b continued)

    Question                                            Answers                                                          Notes                    Total
 14.   b    iii   critical mass: mass required so that «on average» each fission/reaction results in   Accept “minimum mass of fuel needed
                  a further fission/reaction ✔                                                         for the reaction to be self-sustaining”.


                  Any two for [2 max]:
                                                                                                                                                  3 max
                  neutron captured by «235U» nucleus ✔
                                                                                                       Accept answers in the form of suitable
                  fission/reaction produces many neutrons/more than one neutron ✔
                                                                                                       diagrams/equations.
                  if these cause further fission/reaction a chain reaction occurs ✔

 14.   b    iv    produce long lived/long half-life radioisotopes/radioactivity                        Accept “long lived/long half-life
                  OR                                                                                   radioactive waste”.

                  could be used to produce nuclear weapons                                                                                          1
                  OR
                  «nuclear» accidents/meltdowns can occur ✔
                                                                     – 23 –                                      M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                        Answers                                                         Notes                   Total
15.   a      p-type AND has 3 «valence» electrons                                                Do not accept “it is in group 3/13” as
             OR                                                                                  reason.
                                                                                                                                           1
             p-type AND fewer electrons «than silicon» ✔

15.   b      Any two of:
             cheaper
             OR
             ease of fabrication ✔


             use light of lower energy/lower frequency/longer wavelength ✔
             absorb wider range of wavelengths ✔
             dye converts most/all absorbed photons into electrons ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
             plentiful /renewable resources «to construct DSSC cells» ✔
             operate at lower «internal» temperatures/better at radiating heat away «since
             constructed with thin front layer of conductive plastic compared to glass box in
             photovoltaic cell» ✔
             use of nanoparticles provides large surface area exposure to sunlight/sun/light ✔
             can absorb better under cloudy/low light conditions ✔
             better conductivity ✔
             more flexible ✔

15.   c      B AND has greater/more «extensive» conjugation ✔                                    Accept “more alternating single and
                                                                                                 double bonds”.                            1

Option D — Medicinal chemistry

    Question                                           Answers                                                    Notes                       Total
 16.   a        Any one of:                                                                      Accept “prevents/reduces blood clots”
                                                                                                 OR “blood thinner”.
                anticoagulant ✔
                lower risk of heart attack/strokes ✔                                                                                         1 max
                prevent recurrence of heart attack/stroke ✔
                prevent cancer of colon/oesophagus/stomach ✔

 16.   b   i    fraction/proportion/percentage «of administered dosage» that reaches target «part Accept “the ability of the drug to be
                of human body»                                                                    absorbed by the body” OR “the extent to
                OR                                                                                which the drug is absorbed by the
                                                                                                  body”.                                        1
                fraction/proportion/percentage «of administered dosage» that reaches blood
                «plasma»/systemic circulation ✔                                                   Do not accept “the amount/quantity of
                                                                                                  the drug absorbed”.

 16.   b   ii   intravenous injection/IV ✔                                                       Accept “parenterally”.
                                                                                                 Accept “react with alkali/NaOH” OR             1
                                                                                                 “convert to ionic form/salt”.

 16.   c   i    One absorption found in both spectra:                                            Award [1 max] if candidate states bonds
                Any one of:                                                                      (CO in both, O–H in salicylic acid only)
                                                                                                 but doesn’t quote wavelength ranges.
                1050–1410 cm–1 «C–O in alcohols, esters, ethers» ✔
                1700–1750 cm–1 «CO in carboxylic acids, esters» ✔
                2500–3000 cm–1 «O–H in carboxylic acids» ✔                                                                                   2 max
                2850–3090 cm–1 «C–H in alkanes, alkenes, arenes» ✔

                One absorption found in only one of the spectra:
                                                                                                 Accept a second/additional absorption
                3200–3600 cm–1 «O–H in alcohols, phenols» ✔                                      at 1700–1750 cm-1 from CO in ester.

(Question 16c continued)

    Question                                            Answers                                            Notes                    Total
 16.   c    ii    Any two of:
                  ring is «sterically» strained
                  OR
                  ring breaks up/opens/reacts «easily»
                  OR
                  amide/amido group «in ring» is «highly» reactive ✔


                  «irreversibly» binds/bonds to enzyme/transpeptidase                     Award [1 max] for “interferes with
                  OR                                                                      cell wall production”.                   2 max

                  inhibits enzyme/transpeptidase «in bacteria» that produces cell walls   Do not accept “cell membrane” instead
                  OR                                                                      of “cell wall”.

                  prevents cross-linking of bacterial cell walls ✔


                  cells absorb water AND burst
                  OR
                  cells cannot reproduce ✔


                                                                                                                               (continued…)
                                                                            – 26 –                             M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


(Question 16c continued)

    Question                                              Answers                                               Notes                     Total
 16.   c    iii   Any two of:
                  leads to «bacterial» resistance/proportion of resistant bacteria increases
                  OR
                  leads to penicillinase-producing bacteria ✔
                                                                                                                                          2 max

                  damage to/contamination of bodies of water/ecosystems ✔                      Accept “endocrine disruptor”.

                  destroys useful/beneficial bacteria ✔                                        Do not accept “increased cost of
                                                                                               developing antibiotics”.
                  destroyed bacteria replaced by more harmful bacteria ✔

 16.   c    iv    modify side chain ✔                                                                                                       1

 16.   d    i     temporarily bind to/block/interfere with receptor sites in brain
                  OR                                                                                                                        1
                  prevent transmission of pain impulses within CNS/central nervous system ✔

 16.   d    ii    codeine has a wider therapeutic window ✔                                     Accept “codeine has lower activity” OR
                                                                                               “codeine has lower risk of overdose” OR
                                                                                               “codeine is less potent” OR “codeine
                                                                                               has fewer/milder side effects”.

                                                                                                                                            1
                                                                                               Do not accept “lower abuse potential for
                                                                                               codeine” OR “codeine less addictive”
                                                                                               OR “codeine has a lower bioavailability”
                                                                                               OR “codeine available without
                                                                                               prescription” OR “codeine cheaper”.
                                                                          – 27 –                                   M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


  Question                                               Answers                                                   Notes                     Total
16.   e        «pure» enantiomers rotate the plane «of plane-»polarized light «by equal angles»
               in opposite directions ✔


               Any two of:
               find angle of rotation of pure enantiomers ✔                                                                                  3 max

               measure angle of rotation of mixture ✔
               mixture has angle between that of two enantiomers ✔
               ratio of angles gives purity ✔



17.   a   i    MgCO3 (s)  2HCl (aq)  CO2 (g)  H2O (l)  MgCl2 (aq) ✔                           Do not accept “H2CO3”.                       1

17.   a   ii   n(HCl)  2 n(CaCO3)  2 n(MgCO3)                                                   Award [2] for correct final answer.
               OR                                                                                 Award [1 max] for correctly calculating
                                                                                                  amount of acid neutralized by just
                             2  0.680 « g»        2  0.080 « g»                                 CaCO3 (0.014 «mol») OR MgCO3 (0.002
               n(HCl)                   1
                                                                     ✔                                                                        2
                          100.09 « g mol »        84.32 « g mol1 »                               «mol»).


               «n(HCl)  0.0136 mol  0.0019 mol » 0.016 «mol» ✔

17.   b        inhibits the secretion of stomach acid/H ✔
               «active metabolites» bind «irreversibly» to «receptors of the» proton pump ✔       Accept “PPI/proton pump inhibitor”.
                                                                                                  Do not award mark for “binds to              2
                                                                                                  H2/histamine receptors”. (Ranitidine
                                                                                                  mode of action.)
                                                                                                  Accept “H+/K+ ATPase” for “proton pump”.
                                                                      – 28 –                                      M18/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M



  Question                                          Answers                                                        Notes                Total
18.          blocks/inhibits neuraminidase/NA/«viral» enzyme which allows viruses to pass
             through cell membrane ✔
                                                                                                                                         2
             prevent virus from leaving/escaping host cell «thus it cannot infect other cells» ✔



19.   a      Any two of:
             radiation causes breaks in DNA chains                                                 Accept “alters DNA”.
             OR
             radiation causes errors in DNA sequences ✔                                                                                2 max


             «damage accumulates and» cells cannot multiply ✔
             rapidly dividing/cancer cells more susceptible ✔

19.   b      Any two of:
             radiation source delivered directly to «targeted» cancer cells ✔
                                                                                                                                       2 max
             by a carrier drug/protein/antibody ✔
             several sites in body can be targeted «at same time» ✔

  Question                                        Answers                   Notes                 Total
20.   a      «vapour pressure  0.6  17  0.4  24 »
                                                                                                   1
             19.8 «kPa» ✔

20.   b      Any three of:
             different molar masses
             OR
             different strength of intermolecular forces ✔

             different boiling points ✔
                                                                                                 3 max
             temperature in «fractionating» column decreases upwards ✔

             «components» condense at different temperatures/heights

             OR
             «component with» lower boiling point leaves column first ✔
